intro: Hieracium lanipes, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is recognized by its hairy, grayish-green stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, forming a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium lanipes thrives in meadows and grasslands, often in temperate climates.
